roar.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to make a deep, very loud noise
roar.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to shout something in a deep powerful voice
roar.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: ‘Get out of my house!’ he roared.
roar.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: By this time, Michael was roaring with laughter.
roar.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if a vehicle roars somewhere, it moves very quickly and noisily
roar.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The car roared off down the road.
roar.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a deep, loud noise made by an animal such as a lion, or by someone’s voice
roar.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He let out a roar of laughter.
roar.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a continuous loud noise, especially made by a machine or a strong wind
